newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Soproni plans higher dividend on 1996.
newsitem.headline: Soproni plans higher dividend on 1996.

text.p: Hungarian brewery Soproni Sorgyar Rt plans to pay increased dividends on its 1996 results, while brewery Martfu plans an unchanged 15 percent dividend, the companies said on Friday.
Both companies are majority owned by Austria's Brau Union AG, which proposed in January to merge Martfu into Soproni.

Soproni will propose to pay a 16 percent dividend on preference shares on the 1996 results, up from 11 percent on 1995, and will propose paying a 15 percent dividend on ordinary shares against a 10 percent dividend on 1995 results, it said.
Soproni lists its preference shares on the Budapest bourse, while its ordinary shares were not introduced to the market.
Martfu plans to pay an unchanged 15 percent dividend on last year's results, Martfu said in a separate announcement.
Martfu will hold its annual shareholders meeting on April 24 and Soproni on April 25, with shareholders of both voting on the proposed merger.
